page.title: 07AIRFIELDS-SECOND WORLD WAR
page.content: During the 1939-45 war there were a great many airfields scattered throughout the country and in particular,Lincolshire. Kirmington Airport was one such airfield. Towards the end of the war a British bomber was returning to base after a raid on Germany when it was attacked by a German fighter. Severely damaged the aircraft tried to make its base but failed to do so. The aicraft collided with a tree in Brocklesby Woods demolishing the top half of the tree. The crew of the aircraft were all killed. To commemorate those killed the tree has a plaque nailed to its trunk with the names of those killed inscribed. Each year the vicar from Great Limber holds a service at the site.
